Your privacy is of utmost importance to us. At RadioChi.com, we are committed to protecting the privacy of our visitors. This privacy policy describes how we manage information in compliance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679 General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and Organic Law 3/2018 on Personal Data Protection and guarantee of digital rights (LOPDGDD).

1. Data Controller

Owner: Fernando Cardona
NIF/CIF (Optional): not specified
Address (Optional): Madrid
Contact email: fernandocardonatoro2@gmail.com
Website: RadioChi.com

2. Privacy Principles and Data Collection

In accordance with the principles of privacy by design and by default, and data minimization, we explicitly declare that:

This Website does not collect, store or process any type of personal data from its users.

Access and navigation on the Website are completely anonymous and do not require any type of registration or provision of personal information. We do not implement any mechanism that allows user identification, such as:

  • Contact or comment forms.
  • Registration, subscription or user area systems.
  • Newsletters or mailing lists.

3. Cookie Policy

This Website does not use cookies of any type, neither own nor third-party, for analytical, advertising or tracking purposes. Navigation is completely free of trackers, ensuring that your activity is not monitored.

Once you click on these links and leave our page, we will no longer have control over the site to which you are redirected and, therefore, we are not responsible for the terms, privacy or protection of your data on these other third-party sites. Since this Website does not collect any personal data, the exercise of these rights in relation to our web activity is not applicable, as there is no data to act upon. Your privacy is guaranteed by our policy of not collecting information.

For any doubt or inquiry about our privacy policy, you can contact the owner through the email provided in section 1.

6. Privacy Policy Modifications

The owner reserves the right to modify this Privacy Policy to adapt it to legislative or jurisprudential developments, as well as industry practices. These modifications will be communicated on this page with reasonable advance notice before their implementation.

7. Applicable Legislation

This Privacy Policy is governed in each and every one of its aspects by current Spanish and European legislation on data protection.

cookies.title: Cookie Policy
cookies.content:
Last updated: 2025

At RadioChi.com, transparency and privacy of our users are fundamental. This Cookie Policy aims to inform clearly and precisely about the use of cookies on this website, in compliance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679 General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and Law 34/2002 on Information Society Services and Electronic Commerce (LSSI-CE).

1. What are Cookies?

A cookie is a small text file that a website stores in the user's browser. Cookies facilitate the use and navigation of a web page and are essential for the functioning of the Internet, providing countless advantages in the provision of interactive services.

Generally, cookies are used for various purposes, such as recognizing the user, obtaining information about their browsing habits, or personalizing the way content is displayed.

2. Cookie Usage Policy on This Website

In line with our commitment to privacy and the principle of data minimization, we explicitly declare that:

This Website DOES NOT USE any type of cookie, neither own nor third-party.

We do not use any technology that stores information in your browser for tracking, analysis, advertising, or operational purposes. Your visit is completely anonymous and private from our website's perspective.

3. Why Don't We Use Cookies?

Our decision not to use cookies is based on the following principles:

  • Maximum Privacy: We want to ensure that your browsing is completely private and that no data is collected.
  • Simplicity and Transparency: By not using cookies, we don't need to show consent banners, which improves your user experience.
  • Security: We eliminate any security risk associated with managing third-party cookies.

4. How to Manage Cookies in Your Browser (General Information)

Although this website does not use cookies, it's useful for you to know that you can manage, block, or delete them for any other website through your browser settings.

Below, we provide links to the guides of the main browsers:

  • Google Chrome: https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/95647
  • Mozilla Firefox: Cookie management in Firefox
  • Microsoft Edge: Cookie management in Edge
  • Safari (Apple): Cookie management in Safari

Please note that disabling cookies may affect the functioning of many websites.

5. Contact

If you have any questions or inquiries about our Cookie Policy, you can contact us through email: fernandocardonatoro2@gmail.com
